case_title: A. Q. SHAUKAT AND Another vs S. M. JAFAR

related_statutes: Pakistan Administration of Evacuee Property Ordinance, 1949

property_details.location: New Charli Villa near Pindi Point, Murree

issues: Jurisdiction of criminal courts under Section 145, Cr. P.C.
Competency of fresh applications under Section 145, Cr. P.C.
Impact of evacuee property acquisition by the government
Conditions for ad interim attachment of property

appellant: Sections 7, 25, and 29 of the Displaced Persons Act bar criminal court jurisdiction.
Acquisition by the government does not change the jurisdictional bar.
Sub-Divisional Magistrate's earlier order prevents fresh applications.
Attachment order lacks justification for emergency conditions.
respondent: Criminal Procedure Code has broad jurisdiction.
Sections 7, 25, and 29 do not bar criminal court jurisdiction.
Attachment order complies with Section 145, Cr. P.C.
Revisional jurisdiction should not interfere lightly.

court_findings.jurisdiction: Section 25 of the Displaced Persons Act bars criminal court jurisdiction over evacuee property disputes.
court_findings.attachment_order: Magistrate not required to state grounds for emergency under second proviso of Section 145, Cr. P.C.
court_findings.fresh application: Additional District Magistrate's order valid as Sub-Divisional Magistrate did not decide on merits.

judgment_summary.reasoning: Jurisdiction of criminal courts barred under Section 25 of the Displaced Persons Act.
